posts.name: Electra Lucky Norwood
posts.cooked:
The cage is a little threatening for everyone‚Äôs swerve drive modules this year.

Is anybody willing to share any protectors they have made to make sure the cage doesn‚Äôt bust them open?

We are running the REV Ion swerve drive and looking for a good solution to protect our modules.

posts.name: evanperryg
posts.cooked: Seems like 5934 has a nice solution.

posts.name: Electra Lucky Norwood
posts.cooked: I like it, but our plan to climb is to bring the cage inside of our robot. Would work for protecting them from the outside, but inside might be a bit tricky. Hmm‚Ä¶

posts.name: Kirk Anderson
posts.cooked:
We took the step file of the module and inverted the plate the drive motor sits in, and modified the file using push to get it tall enough and printed them.  We are treating them as disposible, and it does leave the steering motor vulnerable depending on your internal build.

image 806√ó702 61.4 KB (hopefully the image loaded, my first post here)

posts.name: Electra Lucky Norwood
posts.cooked:
This looks great! Would you be willing to share the file potentially? This looks similar to what our team was talking about but wanted to see what others had done.

That steering motor is definitely tricky to protect since you need to also ensure that it has room to spin.
